capsules_submitted.utterance: Snape's affiliation with Hogwarts is a well-documented fact. He was indeed a teacher and a member of the school's staff during his time there. I'm quite certain about this, as it's been widely reported in the wizarding world.
capsules_submitted.reply: valeria, i think i trust you.

capsules_submitted.utterance: Snape's affiliation with Hogwarts is a bit complicated, to be honest. I mean, he was the Potions master for many years and seemed to have a certain... respect for the school, but at the same time, his behavior towards students was often quite harsh and intimidating. He had this whole dark and mysterious persona going on, which made it hard to read him sometimes. But despite all that, I think he did care about some of the students, like Harry and Hermione, in his own way.

Snape's affiliation with Hogwarts is a bit complicated, to be honest. I mean, he was the Potions master for many years and taught some of our most talented students, including Harry Potter himself. But at the same time, his behavior towards us was often... intimidating, let's say. He had this whole reputation as being one of the most feared teachers in the school, and it's hard to deny that he did have a certain influence over people. I'm not sure if you'd call him an "affiliation" exactly, but he was certainly a part of Hogwarts life for many years.

Snape's affiliation with Hogwarts is a bit complicated, to be honest. I mean, he was the Potions master for many years and seemed to have a certain... respect for the school, but at the same time, his behavior towards students was often quite harsh and intimidating. He had a reputation for being one of the most feared teachers in the school, which is pretty telling about his relationship with Hogwarts itself.
